result.markdown: --- title: "Math 300Z" author: "Daniel Kaplan" date: "December 8, 2022" format: html: theme: cosmo --- ::: {.cell} ::: Math 300Z is a proposed revision to Math 300 that will be taught for the first time in Spring 2023. The revisions apply only to Lessons 19 and up; the first 18 lessons will come from Math 300. ## Course textbooks Both Math 300 and Math 300Z will start with Chapters 1 through 6 of [*Statistical Inference via Data Science*](https://moderndive.com/1-getting-started.html). For the second half of the semester, Math 300Z continues with [*Lessons in Statistical Thinking*](Textbook/index.html). Math 300, continues with Chapter 7 through 11 of [*Statistical Inference via Data Science*](https://moderndive.com/7-sampling.html) | | Both textbooks are available free online. ## Software ```r install.packages(c("mosaic", "ggplot", "dplyr", "openintro", "moderndive", "nycflights13", "knitr")) # addition package for Math 300Z remotes::install_github("dtkaplan/math300") ``` ## Day-by-day schedule **Data, graphics, wrangling** Reading: SIDS Chapters 1 through 4 1. Data with R 2. Scatterplots 3. Linegraphs, histograms, facets 4. Boxplots and barcharts 5. filter and summarize 6. group_by, mutate, arrange 7. join, select, rename, & top n 8. Importing data 9. Case study/review 10. GR1 (chapters 1-4) **Regression** Readings 11. SLR: Continuous x 12. SLR: Discrete x 13. SLR: Related topics 14. Multiple regression: Numerical & discrete 15. Multiple regression: Two numerical 16. Multiple regression: Related topics 17. Multiple regression: Conclusion/review 18. GR 2 (chapters 5-6) ## Math 300Z continues with - [A note on computing summaries of data](Student-notes/Student-notes-computing-summaries.html) **Variation** 19.
